metadata.synopsis: After Nick (Horatio Sanz) makes an insensitive remark, his travel agent decides to get some payback by sending him and his best friend, Jerry (Cuba Gooding Jr.), on a cruise for gay men. As the true nature of their situation gradually dawns on them, they start to get over their feelings of homophobia and meet potential mates. For Nick, love takes the form of a gorgeous model, Inga (Victoria Silvstedt), while Jerry develops feelings for dance instructor Gabriella (Roselyn Sánchez).

reviews: Even the unrated version should be lost at sea.
Stereotyping, iffy humor in dated, unfunny comedy.
Like a bad TV sitcom, the cruise ship plucks a stranded Swedish sun-tanning team from the ocean to comply with Hollywood's current unofficial cleavage quotient.
Cuba Gooding Jr. is the kind of guy who does ten minutes of shtick every time the little light in the fridge comes on.
It also has one of the most lame plots in the history of lame plots.
Only Cuba Gooding Jr., the Olivier of his generation, could pull off such a daring commentary on modern manners.
As painful as you imagine it is.
[Gooding's] performance here isn't as energetic as it is desperate.
Esta comdia poderia at funcionar como um esquete do Saturday Night Live (o que combinaria at mesmo com o elenco), mas, como um longa de 94 minutos de durao,  irregular, cansativa e pouco original.
Boat Trip goes bottoms up early.
No one comes off worse than Cuba Gooding, Jr., whom the Academy of Motion Picture Arts & Sciences could sue for defamation had the movie's advertisements put 'Academy Award winner' before his name.

Apart from my disappointment that Roger Moore didn't use any funny Bond-related lines (let's face it, "license to drill" or "for your eyes only" would have been hilarious coming out of his mouth), the movie more than exceeded my expectations.
If Boat Trip were a skin disease, you'd have whatever limb it was found on amputated at the base.
A lot of movies aim for the lowest common denominator. Boat Trip is merely low.
This is a tasteless and tacky farce laced with cheap homophobic jokes and cringe-inducing stereotypes ...
Poor Cuba Gooding Jr. After his surprising and deserving Oscar win in Jerry Maguire, his career has gone absolutely nowhere.
The real issue is that it is not funny.
It's enough to make you wonder, where's an iceberg when you need it?
